meanings.sent1: The new employee had a clerklier demeanor than the others.
meanings.sent2: She organized the files in a clerklier fashion than usual.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to act clerklier by sitting at the desk.
meanings.sent4: His handwriting became clerklier as he practiced more.
meanings.sent5: The office supplies looked clerklier after the cleaning staff rearranged them.

meanings.definition: In a manner resembling a clerk.
meanings.sent1: She typed clerklier on the keyboard to mimic the clerk's speed.
meanings.sent2: He greeted customers clerklier than the other employees.
meanings.sent3: The dog followed the mail carrier clerklier than its owner.
meanings.sent4: The leaves rustled clerklier in the wind as autumn approached.
meanings.sent5: The child imitated the librarian clerklier as they checked out books.
